meanings.definition: To absorb or integrate into a larger group or culture.
meanings.sent1: The new student quickly assimilated into the class, making friends easily.
meanings.sent2: She assimilated the customs of her new country after moving there.
meanings.sent3: The alien tried to assimilate into human society by wearing a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset assimilated into a beautiful painting in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sponge assimilated all the water in the sink, leaving it dry.

meanings.definition: To understand and take in information or ideas.
meanings.sent1: After reading the book twice, she finally assimilated the complex plot.
meanings.sent2: He assimilated the instructions for the experiment before starting.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to assimilate the joke but ended up short-circuiting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind assimilated the new concept like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The student assimilated the history lesson by creating a colorful mind map.

meanings.definition: To cause something to resemble or become similar to something else.
meanings.sent1: The artist assimilated different styles to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent2: The chef assimilated flavors from various cuisines to craft a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon tried to assimilate into the background but turned bright pink instead.
meanings.sent4: The music assimilated the sounds of nature, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer assimilated traditional and modern elements in the new collection.
